Access to Education – Photography Competition

  • Entry Dates  
  • Latest Entries  
  • Theme  
  • Guidelines  
  • Prizes  

Take a digital photo that celebrates life and learning in Belfast and enter our Community Access Competition to support the next steps in your learning journey.

Prizes include an SLR camera for the overall winner, access to Education Mentors and opportunity to sell your creative photo through the University student Art Shop Unique and more.

Enter competition

Our partners

A Celebration of Life & Learning in Belfast City

We particularly encourage entries from those living throughout Northern Ireland who would like to celebrate life and learning within Belfast City.

All those entering the competition are invited to attend the Ulster University’s School of Art End of Year Show 2019.

As part of the University Access Plan we are committed to supporting the wellbeing and educational attainment of communities who traditionally would not have direct access to Higher Education.

The competition opens from 9 am on Thursday 11th April 2019 to 9 pm on Friday 3rd May 2019

Enter Competition

Latest entries

View full gallery

Civic Theme

Healthy Communities

Photographs should be submitted aligned to one of the following categories:

  1. Positive Mental Health
  2. Ageing - people, generations and or the built environment
  3. Health Innovation and Policy - 'In Belfast City' eg Belfast Bikes, Park Runs, Healthy park spaces
  4. Sport for Life - Sports for all ages, family, eg sports teams, activities and environment
  5. History and Heritage - Capturing the history and heritage of the city

Guidelines

Submit a digital photo which demonstrates your view of celebrating life and learning in Belfast City in relation to building a healthy community.

To complete your entry please include:

  • Your photo
  • Your name, age and postcode and contact details
  • The category you wish to enter ie choose from
    1. Positive Mental Health
    2. Ageing
    3. Health Innovation and Policy
    4. Sport for Life
    5. History and Heritage
  • Acceptance of the competition terms and conditions
  • Indicate if you would like to receive information on education opportunities, workshops and events

Each competition entry will be displayed on the digital wall (See Terms & Conditions)

Prizes

100 entries will be shortlisted across the 5 categories listed above.

Each of the successful shortlisted entries will receive a Flexible Education Merchandise Bag.

In addition, from the 100 successful shortlisted entries there will be a total of 20 winners, selected across the competition categories (4 in each category – listed above) who will be offered:

  1. Access to an Education Mentor
  2. Their competition entry printed and framed
  3. Opportunity to present their competition entry for sale in the Unique Student Art Shop - Belfast Campus
  4. Entry to the University Community Education Exhibition

One person will achieve the Overall Competition Winner Status and be presented with an SLR camera (Sponsored by PwC and Ulster University).

The independent expert judging panel will be made up from Price Waterhouse Coopers and Ulster University Faculty of Arts Humanities and Social Sciences staff.
